column4: I'm gonna try GParted for now, although I have another question - How do i get rid of "Authentication" windows, they keep coming, can't I just authenticate once for good?
those windows are placed for your own security
there are some changes that could seriously damage your operating system install, by seeing those password requests, you know that you're about to modify something "important"
and once you enter your password, it won't ask for it again for some time
if you really want to remove the password requests, add your user to the /etc/sudoers file
add a line that goes yourusername ALL=NOPASSWD: ALL
trust me, you'll be safer leaving ubuntu as it is...
just as a side note, being open source isn't the only advantage of linux based distributions... and being open source isn't something that only Linux is, there are other open source operating systems
make sure that you're copying them back to the right location and restart firefox
